action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Commerce. H. Rept. 106-949.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 301.

action.text: Mr. Bilirakis moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 575.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/10/2000--Passed House amended. Urges U.S. citizens to recognize and support educational programs that make surfing the Internet safe. Supports initiatives to educate parents, children, educators, and community leaders about the enormous possibilities and potential dangers of the Internet. Urges all Americans to become informed about the Internet and to support proactive efforts to provide Internet safety for children and future generations. Expresses the appreciation of the House of Representative for all law enforcement officials working to protect America's children when they are online.
